post.author: modern
post.body:
I'm downloading a demo of HL2. I can see its called steaminstall. I have heared alot of people saying really bad things about steam.

What is Steam?

Does my PC have to be connected to the internet to play HL2?

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
modern wrote:
What is Steam?[/quote)

Content delivery and authentification system.

[quote]Does my PC have to be connected to the internet to play HL2?


AFAIK yes.

post.author: modern
post.body:
The majority of Artists I know use Macs, and I'm no different. I only invested in a PC so that I could investigate game modification. I run a simple system, and it is not even connected to the internet.

I share a broadband connetion with my house mate which I pick up with an Airport Extreme card. I could share my connection with the PC (i've tried a crossover cable) but I just cannot get my Mac and PC to talk to each other?

Ohwell, guess I wont be buying HL2.

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body:
mac's & pc (and SGI's) talk to gether a-ok. I've done it. Windows networking won't work perfectly (actuatly, I've had BETTER luck with Linux computer on a windows netwoking then windows machines...).

i'd just hook both computer up to a hub, then hook that to the router your net comes in to.

or go wireless if you can.

post.author: _shank
post.body:
modern wrote:

Does my PC have to be connected to the internet to play HL2?


Not really, you need to be online to install it and not to play it. So once you have installed it you DONT NEED INTERNET.

post.author: SnoopJeDi
post.body: Not sure about the demo, but the CD version, you must be online while decrypting/activating the hl2 files, but then can play offline.
